SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.megatome.frame2.validator
Class CommonsFieldValidator

java.lang.Object
  org.megatome.frame2.validator.CommonsFieldValidator

public class CommonsFieldValidator
extends Object

This is the wrapper for Commons Validation. The methods in this class should be used in the rules file for validating, as they will correctly set Errors objects. Developer wishing to create custom validators should extend this class.

validateEmail

public static boolean validateEmail(String value,
                                    ValidatorAction va,
                                    Errors errors,
                                    Field field)
Validate an email address. Null values pass validation, as this allows them to be optional.

Parameters:
value - The value to validate as an email address.
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if the email address passes validation, or is null.

validateIntRange

public static boolean validateIntRange(Object bean,
                                       ValidatorAction va,
                                       Errors errors,
                                       Field field)
Validate that a value falls within a specified integer range.

Parameters:
bean - The event containing the field to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if the value is an integer, and falls within the range specified in the rules file.

validateIntRange

public static boolean validateIntRange(String value,
                                       ValidatorAction va,
                                       Errors errors,
                                       Field field)
Validate that a value falls within a specified integer range.

Parameters:
value - The value to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if the value is an integer, and is within the range. Also returns true if one of "min" or "max" is null.

                                        Field field)
Validate that a value contains at least a certain number of characters.

Parameters:

Returns:

validateMinLength

public static boolean validateMinLength(String value,
                                        ValidatorAction va,
                                        Errors errors,
                                        Field field)
Validate that a value contains at least a certain number of characters.

Parameters:
value - The value to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if the value is greater than or equal to the minimum length, is null, or the minimum length to check against is null.

Parameters:
value - The value to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if the value is less than or equal to the maximum length, is null, or the maximum length to check against is null.

validateTwoFields

public static boolean validateTwoFields(Object bean,
                                        ValidatorAction va,
                                        Errors errors,
                                        Field field)
Validate the contents of two fields to verify that they match. This is useful for comparing a password and a confirmation value, for instance.

Parameters:
bean - The event containing the fields to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The first field to validate
Returns:
True if the first field is null, or if the first and second fields contain identical values.

validateRequiredIf

public static boolean validateRequiredIf(Object bean,
                                         ValidatorAction va,
                                         Errors errors,
                                         Field field)
Validate a value that is required if a certain circumstance is met.

Parameters:
bean - The event containing the field to validate
va - The validator action
errors - Errors object to populate
field - The field to validate
Returns:
True if validation passes
